body: Related to the above, the subject scope/subject domains are given to us in the DID-CORE specification:  Decentralized Identifiers (DIDs) v1.0 Specification Reference: https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/  > Decentralized identifiers (DIDs) are a new type of identifier that enables verifiable, decentralized digital identity. A DID refers to any subject (e.g., a person, organization, thing, data model, abstract entity, etc.) as determined by the controller of the DID. In contrast to typical, federated identifiers, DIDs have been designed so that they may be decoupled from centralized registries, identity providers, and certificate authorities.  > DID subject > The entity identified by a DID and described by a DID document. Anything can be a DID subject: person, group, organization, physical thing, digital thing, logical thing, etc.
